intro: Satureja metastasiantha, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of California and Nevada. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pink to purple, arranged in whorls along the stem, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Satureja metastasiantha is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and meadows.
